queries.description: A /* or // character sequence within a comment is sometimes indicative of a missed comment and should not be allowed.
queries.name: The character sequences /* and // shall not be used within a comment

RULE-3-1.title: The character sequences /* and // shall not be used within a comment

queries.description: Entering a newline following a '\' character can erroneously commenting out regions of code.
queries.name: Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments

RULE-3-2.title: Line-splicing shall not be used in // comments

queries.description: Not explicitly terminating octal and hexadecimal escape sequences can results in developer confusion and lead to programming errors.
queries.name: Octal and hexadecimal escape sequences shall be terminated

RULE-4-1.title: Octal and hexadecimal escape sequences shall be terminated

queries.description: Commented out code may become out of date leading to developer confusion.
queries.name: Sections of code should not be commented out

DIR-4-4.title: Sections of code should not be commented out

queries.description: Typographically ambiguous identifiers can lead to developer confusion.
queries.name: Identifiers in the same name space with overlapping visibility should be typographically unambiguous

DIR-4-5.title: Identifiers in the same name space with overlapping visibility should be typographically unambiguous

queries.description: A  'U' or 'u' suffix shall be applied to all integer constants that are represented in an unsigned type.
queries.name: A 'U' or 'u' suffix shall be applied to all unsigned integers constants

RULE-7-2.title: A 'U' or 'u' suffix shall be applied to all integer constants that are represented in an unsigned type

queries.description: Using the lowercase letter l in a literal suffix can be mistaken for other characters such as 1.
queries.name: The lowercase character l shall not be used in a literal suffix

RULE-7-3.title: The lowercase character l shall not be used in a literal suffix
